title: The Science of Muscle Memory: How Your Brain Learns to Type
description: Understanding the neuroscience behind skill acquisition can help you learn faster.
author: Free Online Typing Team
content:
Procedural Memory

Typing is a procedural memory task, stored in the basal ganglia. It moves from conscious effort (cortex) to automatic execution.

Repetition vs. Sleep

You don't improve while practicing, but while sleeping after practice. Sleep consolidates the motor patterns.
